title: Sri Lanka schedules 3 hours 20 min power cuts on April 20
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Power cuts of 3 hours and 20 minutes have been approved for Sri Lanka on April 20, 2022, Public Utilities Commission Chairman Janaka Ratnayake said as forex shortages due to money printing by the central bank triggered forex shortages disrupting fuel imports.
All Areas (ABCDEFGHIJKLPQRSTUVW) will have power cuts of 2 hours from 0900am to 0500pm and 1 hour and 20 minutes from 0500pm and 0900pm.

Though rains have started to come, Sri Lanka is facing severe forex shortages from a flexible exchange rate (intermediate regime soft-peg). An attempt to float the currency (suspend convertibility) has not succeeded amid a surrender requirement. (Colombo/ April 18/2022)
